title: Argentina [1] - [0] Mexico time for the goat

author: kylemo9886
text: i’m a very casual soccer watcher…can somebody educate me…why isn’t there somebody marking Messi. this feels like the equivalent of leaving Steph Curry wide open behind the three point line. am I missing something ? thanks

author: sman612
text: it’s like zone defense in nfl. each player has their position and I assume one of the midfielders left him too much space here. prior to this goal he was being marked well they slipped up here

author: [deleted]
text: Basically every time Messi plays there’s 2-3 players marking him and it’s very hard for him to get past people and they make it difficult sometimes especially these days how’s he’s a bit older he finds it hard to do things that he did when he was younger and same thing happened this game Mexico was very defensive marked him well the whole most of the game so, Messi purposely didn’t get himself involved too much and played more deep waiting for that one moment like this where they won’t expect him to be there this is what he does this man’s IQ is on another level

author: dlg898
text: they were except for that one millisecond in which Messi saw that they weren't and took advantage, you can see the midfielder recognize his mistake and run to close him down when Messi gets the ball

author: 1dd00bb1
text: They were keeping to their positions as the play was quite deep into their goal. Messi was playing bit further from usual and there were two players ahead of him, if all of them charge to Messi the other two would’ve got an easy pass. By the time Mexican defenders saw the danger the shot was already on it’s way.

author: victorwithclasspart2
text: There is no 3 point line in soccer is the main thing you are missing

author: ElVeintyQuatro
text: Messi is Messi. He's a world class athlete with top tier skill and IQ; as the other comments have mentioned. But part of it is also the age and fatigue of the Mexican defenders. So much energy having to guard Messi, you make one mistake, and like Curry, it's Night Night.

author: ElVeintyQuatro
text: This is not a take. But I'm drunk so you're probably right.

author: MaybeRipper
text: He just phrased it badly. They didn't expect Messi to try long. They were expecting a cross like the last times so they were not marking Messi as much because he was further back and not going to receive cross but they still had 2 defenders near him. But it was too late by the time they closed the distance he already shot.
